Tasks.Task Description: Identify the analytics requirements, data sources, and expected outcomes for the Azure Data Factory project. Document the scope and objectives clearly.

Tasks.Task: Assess Data Sources and Integration Needs
Tasks.Task Description: Evaluate the data sources to be integrated, including on-premises databases, cloud storage, and third-party APIs. Determine the data formats and connectivity requirements.
Create a detailed design for the data pipelines, including data ingestion, transformation, and loading processes. Define dependencies and scheduling requirements.

Tasks.Task: Set Up Azure Data Factory Instance
Tasks.Task Description: Provision a new Azure Data Factory instance in the Azure portal. Configure the instance with the appropriate region and resource group.
Set up linked services to connect Azure Data Factory to data sources and destinations, such as Azure Blob Storage, SQL databases, or external APIs.
Create and configure data pipelines in Azure Data Factory. Define activities for data ingestion, transformation, and loading based on the project requirements.
Configure security settings, including role-based access control (RBAC), managed identities, and encryption for data at rest and in transit.
Perform end-to-end testing of the data pipelines to ensure data is ingested, transformed, and loaded correctly. Validate data accuracy and pipeline performance.
Configure monitoring and alerting for pipeline runs using Azure Monitor and Data Factory's built-in monitoring tools. Set up alerts for failures and performance issues.
Analyze pipeline performance metrics and optimize activities, data flows, and resource usage to improve efficiency and reduce costs.
Create detailed documentation for the pipeline configurations, including linked services, activities, and schedules. Share documentation with the operations team.
Provide training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Data Factory pipelines and monitoring tools.
Ensure the Azure Data Factory setup complies with organizational and regulatory requirements. Implement auditing mechanisms to track data pipeline activities.
Use Azure Monitor to track the status of pipeline runs, identify failures, and ensure timely resolution of issues.
Regularly check the accuracy and completeness of data processed by Azure Data Factory pipelines to ensure analytics reliability.
Create backups of pipeline configurations to safeguard against accidental changes or deletions.
Conduct failover and recovery tests to ensure Azure Data Factory pipelines can recover from unexpected outages.
Analyze pipeline dependencies to identify and resolve potential bottlenecks or conflicts in data processing workflows.
Ensure that Azure Data Factory and its dependencies are updated with the latest security patches and updates.
Review Azure Data Factory usage and cost metrics to identify opportunities for cost optimization.
Ensure Azure Data Factory pipelines adhere to organizational and regulatory compliance requirements.
Investigate and resolve incidents reported by users or monitoring systems related to Azure Data Factory pipelines.
